revision.comment: Dicklyon moved page [[Talk:Iven Carl Kincheloe, Jr.]] to [[Talk:Iven Carl Kincheloe Jr.]]: per [[WP:JR]]
revision.text:
{{Talk header}} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Biography|living=no|class=B|military-work-group=yes|listas=Kincheloe, Iven}} {{WikiProject Military history|class=start|b1=n|b2=y|b3=y|b4=y|b5=y|Aviation=yes|US=yes|Biography=yes}} {{WikiProject Aviation|class=C|b1=n|b2=y|b3=y|b4=y|b5=y|Biography=yes}} }}
==Photo?== I've read Kinch was considered the finest test pilot of his generation. Is it true he was black? (I confess ignorance...) Is a pic available? [[User:Trekphiler|Trekphiler]] 00:04, 6 December 2005 (UTC)
Black? I'm wondering if you're thinking of the fictional character of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hogan%27s_heroes#Staff_Sergeant_Kinchloe Ivan Kinchloe] from TV's [[Hogan's Heroes]] (potentially a tribute to the real Kincheloe)? [[User:Greg Salter|Greg Salter]] 16:59, 24 June 2007 (UTC)
::Hogan's Heroes' Sgt. Kinchloe a tribute to Iven Kincheloe - that's a hoot! Seriously, the introduction states that he was a double ace (10 kills) in Korea, but later the article says he downed 5 MiG-15s during the conflict (which would "just" make him an ace, unless he downed five aircraft that weren't MiG-15s which would seem unlikely. Checking other sources, it appears the five kill total is correct, so the lead paragraph needs to be corrected. [[User:Jmdeur|Jmdeur]] ([[User talk:Jmdeur|talk]]) 18:44, 23 April 2009 (UTC) :::The Hogan's Heroes character was from Detroit, Michigan... worth checking!--[[User:Paulmcdonald|Paul McDonald]] ([[User talk:Paulmcdonald|talk]]) 21:49, 24 May 2010 (UTC)
==Iven or Ivan?== *Iven: **[http://www.google.co.za/search?hl=en&q=%22Iven+C.+Kincheloe%22+-wikipedia ~593 Google hits] **2005-02-19 [http://web.archive.org/web/20050219103450/http://www.setp.org/HTML/Awards/Criteria/Kincheloe.htm SETP] **jsc.nasa bios: ***2003-01 [http://www.jsc.nasa.gov/Bios/htmlbios/fullerton-cg.html Fullerton] ***1996-01 [http://www.jsc.nasa.gov/Bios/htmlbios/haise-fw.html Haise] ***1994-12 [http://www.jsc.nasa.gov/Bios/htmlbios/brandenstein-dc.html Brandenstein] ***1993-06 [http://www.jsc.nasa.gov/Bios/htmlbios/slayton.html Slayton] **c1957/1971 {{cite book|last=Randel|first=Hugh W. (Lt. Col., USAF (MC)))|editor=Neil D. Van Sickle (Major General, USAF (Ret))|title=Modern airmanship|origyear=1957|edition=4|year=1971|publisher=Van Nostrand Reinhold Company|location=[[New York, New York]], USA|language=English|id=<!--Dewey 629.13 Van, 402 37?, F8991-000-9-->|pages=379, 381|chapter=7 Medical Aspects of Flight|lccn=71143545}} ***This book however gets his surname wrong in chapter 10: ****c1957/1971 {{cite book|last=Welch|first=John F. (Captain Strategic Air Command, USAF)|editor=Neil D. Van Sickle (Major General USAF (Ret))|title=Modern airmanship|origyear=1957|edition=4|year=1971|publisher=Van Nostrand Reinhold Company|location=[[New York, New York]], USA|language=English|id=<!--Dewey 629.13 Van, 402 37?, F8991-000-9-->|pages=621|chapter=10 Flying Higher-Performance Aircraft (9 in 1st (1957) edition)|quote=One flight was flown by Capt. Iven C. Kinchloe [sic]|lccn=71143545}} **? [http://www.wpafb.af.mil/museum/history/korea/kc14.htm wpafb.af.mil] **? [http://www.scaled.com/projects/tierone/shane.htm Scaled Composites]
*Ivan: **[http://www.google.co.za/search?hl=en&q=%22Ivan+C.+Kincheloe%22+-wikipedia ~133 Google hits] **jsc.nasa bios: **2005-05 [http://www.scaled.com/projects/tierone/melvill.htm Scaled Composites] ***1997-09 [http://www.jsc.nasa.gov/Bios/htmlbios/crippen-rl.html Crippen] **1995-07-07 [http://liftoff.msfc.nasa.gov/Academy/History/APOLLO-13/mattingly.html msfc.nasa.gov Mattingly] **jsc.nasa bios: ***1992-03 [http://www.jsc.nasa.gov/Bios/htmlbios/truly-rh.html Truly] ***1987-03 [http://www.jsc.nasa.gov/Bios/htmlbios/engle-jh.html Engle] ***1987-01 [http://www.jsc.nasa.gov/Bios/htmlbios/mattingly-tk.html Mattingly] **1979-09-23 [http://www.nytimes.com/1979/09/23/books/1979wolfe-right.html NY Times] **? [http://www.au.af.mil/au/goe/eaglebios/89bios/fulton89.htm au.af.mil]

:Mention of "The Right Stuff" made me think of [[Gus Grissom]]'s middle name. I'm guessing all traces of Ivan will soon disappear. -- [[User:Jeandré du Toit|Jeandré]], 2007-06-25[[User talk:Jeandré du Toit|t]]17:59z ::FYI. --[[User:Jtir|Jtir]] 20:02, 25 June 2007 (UTC) ::*[http://www.yeahbaby.com/baby-names-popularity.php?name=Ivan Baby names popularity for Ivan] ::*[http://www.yeahbaby.com/baby-names-popularity.php?name=Iven Baby names popularity for Iven]
== Kincheloe AFB.closure ==
The date of the base closure is listed as October, 1971. I was stationed there from October 1973 to June 1977. I believe the base closed in October, 1977
[[User:208.189.200.2|208.189.200.2]] 20:02, 7 February 2007 (UTC)
